results.title: Relays
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Harold Young and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
Training film produced in collaboration with the US Olympic Association and the Amateur Athletics Union. Techniques to improve relay team’s performance. Looks at the responsibilities of the relay members, different types of baton passes, fixed and running starts. Narrated by Bill Slater.

results.title: Javelin
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
A demonstration of the four-stage catapult throw, the preliminary run, the concluding stride, the throwing stance, and other useful points about the technique of the javelin throw.

results.title: High jump
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Harold Young, United States Olympic Association and United World Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United world track and field series”.
Instructional film which takes us through an in-depth examination of high jump technique. Use of slow-motion and still camerawork of champion high-jumpers allows detailed explanation of correct running approach, the proper method of lifting and rolling at the bar and correct landing. Some common faults are pointed out and advice is given on how best to achieve optimal performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmund Dorfmann, Harold Young, United States Olympic Association and United World Films
results.description:

results.title: Broad jump
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Amateur Athletic Union and United States Olympic Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “United World Track and Field”
Shows the development of the technique of broad jump, aka long jump, through to its correct conception and exercise. The balanced development of mobility and well performed athlete.

results.title: The World Meteorological Organization
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, V.R. Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
Traces the history of the World meteorological Organization - a Genva based Specialised Agency of the United Nations. Describes the activities and functions of the organization and explains its role as a co-ordinating body in study of weather phenomena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Krishna Singh, V.R. Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information

results.title: The Trusteeship Council and system
results.creator_credit: J.C. Sheers and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: its charter and organization”
Demonstrates the aims, structure and mechanics of the Trusteeship Council by showing the improved standard of living and eventual independence of Somaliland under the administration of Italy.
